attributes.action: Improve Care standards through Professional Development and Staff Training
attributes.additional_details:
We the undersigned call on the Department of Health to legislate ensuring that all care staff working with people with learning disabilities and autism in a residential care setting are required to meet a minimum set of qualifications and have relevant experience in the field before being employed to positions caring for clients with these conditions.
1.Care staff & agency must be treated as skilled professionals, employment being subject to suitable experience/qualifications
2.If staff are supporting an individual with challenging needs including Autism they must be taught positive behavioral support techniques and safe physical interventions
3 Individuals with challenging needs must be given equal rights within disability discrimination legislation and the human rights charter; to ensure they do not live in fear of harm, have dignity and access to justice. Physical interventions reviewed proactively rather than, crisis management. Inappropriate use will be treated as assault
